column5: The smoked 1/2 chicken is also VERY good
Is it the one with the TTC streetcar? Great place to stop on the way th Sauble Beah with the kids!
Well I'm betting that it's definitely NOT the DQ. I know Teds Range Rd Diner, but that's off 26.
So does Magnatta winery on the 400. I guess the MTO guys like their wine!
Oh, I wouldn't know anything about Fanny's...
Ah...  used to be Leons. Still not bad.
Nope used to be Lee-Roys Bar-B-Que.
webbers for bergers on 11

This might be the other one I forgot to mention. Is it right where highway 10 ends? Thats the one I'm thinking of called 'champ burger.' That place is amazing. Always stop there on the way to tobermory for summer camping.

Blue Star - Welland, Ontario Chip 'n ' Charlies - Niagara Falls, Ontario Clancys - Niagara Falls, New York Johnstons - Ransomville, New York Pontellos - Batavia, New York Antonios - South River, Ontario Noels Pizza - Grand Falls, New Brunswick  Been to all of them multiple times and recommend stopping by for a bite if you are ever in those areas.

There used to be a number of great Mom & Pop places along the old 69, but are all gone.  Still French River Trading Post is decent. The Haven in Pointe Au Baril used to be good. Webers is just a tourist trap serving undersized burgers at an inflated price. They were good once, but that was decades back. Almost forgot, big brekkies at the Husky just off the 400, and the restaurant at Tudhope Pk not to bad for brekkie either.

X2 for that. My folks used to have a place in Tobermory and that burger stop was always part of the plans on the way through. I have not been over that way for 6-7 years now so I don't know if it is still there. But it was one of the best burger joints I have ever been in.

If travelling east from Sudbury to North Bay on Hwy 17 there's a place called Kate's Restaurant, is an excellent breakfast. Just a small place, owned by Mennonites, so most of the food is home made.  Very friendly staff.  I was there last Saturday on my way to the annual M&G on Callandar.  Best toasted western I've ever had.  I'ts approx 4 km east of Hagar.  Randy U must know this place.
Danny's gets another vote from me. Been stopping there for nigh on 15 years now. Food is awesome and the waitresses aren't hard to look at.
If you're ever fishing the Tri-Lakes, Jesse'e Tap & Grill in Ennismore is always worth a visit. I second the Peppermill in Carnarvon, for simpler fare in the area the Millpond is a good bet.

Okay, going through a few more Restaurantica posts. I'll just report on the ones near or on the way to fishing spots.  The Ponderosa, 12 Front St. in McTier, had a lovely breakfast there a couple of years ago.  Just Eddies, 598 Atherley Road, Orillia, right near the narrows.  Falls View, 9 Lindsay St., Fenelon Falls. Not fine dining, just family place, but excellent variety of dishes. And you can't beat sitting right beside the falls!  The Mill Cafe 12 Bridge St., Thornbury. Had a venison stew there that was divine! They have an outside deck beside the water.  The Riverhouse, right beside the Severn Falls Marina on Big Chute Rd.
In Kinmount the Kinvale Restaurant the best toasted westerns in the area.In Harcourt try The South Algonguin restaurant good food.
Kinmount used to have the best fish and chips ever. I don't know what happened to the place though.  Best place now is still on 5th Street and Lakeshore in downtown T.O.
If yer down EAST,Dicks has the best fish and chips and stuff,n. Then again,it,s on Bell island NFLD.LOL
"Just for the Halibut" in Bobcageon.   Eat in or take out
Bullocks Bistro in old town Yellowknife NWT.    :thumbsup_anim: They are the only place that serves a beer battered fish that compares to mine.

You'll have to really pay attention to get into Danny's Justa Pasta now as they got bypassed to a degree....  And as for Dan's entry for the best Chicken Parmagana... I'll have to go try it and see if it's better than the Village Idiot at Dundas/McCaul in TO (across from the Art Museum). Or maybe it's just the pints of Fuller's London Pride that gets me in there..
Yup, but they now how their OWN ministry sign! I guess the MTO guys liked their free meals.haha

If you're coming up highway 17 from Ottawa just west of Deep River in alittle town called Rolphton. Hit up the Rolphton Motel for great homemade pizza.    They're also the start of the snowmobile trails for the Upper Ottawa Valley. Dan O.

I second Just for halibut in Bobcaygeon, I'm 99% sure that was the name of the place I ate at last and the fish n chips are good!  If you're coming down the 401 by toronto and want a great sub, nothing really beats Belly Busters just south a few blocks on Yonge St.  The chip truck on #28 south of Stoney is pretty good too.
I'm only a 1/2 mile from there and my wife and I often stop in for something to eat and for me, it's usually their great poutine.
Chip truck in Coboconk, near the IGA.
Busters BBQ on HWY 17 in Vermillion Bay. Bullpit Steakhouse just off the 17 in Waldhof (Vermillion Bay area)

I am personally a fan of the "pizza hut" pizza served at the Fanny's gentlemans establishment in North Bay  Thames river near Delaware we always stop for Chester's chicken in the convenience store beside the bait shop
A definite  to Busters. Great Ribs and a great BBQ Sauce.

I first thought about this while driving 1100kms to my fly-in fishing trip this past September, and another post reminded me again.  What are your favourite places to eat at while on the road? It's getting harder and harder now with the 400 series hwy and the proliferation of chains to find a good spot to get good eats.  To be honest, I don't have much to offer because the two places we used to stop at between T.O. and North Bay (the part of the province I've traveled the most) are no more.  The only one I can think of is Stolley's (sp?) in Kingston. It's not on the hwy and is actually down by Queens university. Good burgers and great fries. One problem is that the clientele is predominately students and if you're older than about 25 a large group of them can be a bit much at times. An early Lunch on Saturdays or Sundays can be funny 'cause the all the kids will hung over hard.

Antonio's in South River - good lasagna and sandwiches.  Chinese in Temagami - Helen and Terry's place - don't even have to tell her what I want.  Rob Roy's Pub & Restaurant in Smiths Falls - main drag.. right where the bridge starts on west side of street last building heading south  ..or Gerbo's right across the street for nice Greasy pizza.. a delicacy for me since the '60's !

Fast Eddies in Tok Alaska. Toad River Lodge in Toad River BC  Almost forgot one of my favorite burger joints. Apache Burger at Dundas and Kipling. When I'm back in Ontario I go out of my way to chow down there.
Good topic!  I'm heading to sudbury for the weekend, would love to stop somewhere good for lunch and find a good place for dinner
#58?  or is it the S&S chicken with rice and pineapple?

Dan, the restaurant at the french river trading post is pretty good. In gravenhurst, there is a new restaurant that offers the FRESHEST food around! They are only open certain times of the day so they can get their ingredients. For the life of me I can't remember its name, its on the main stretch, left hand side as you enter northbound from hwy11. The GBay whitefish was fantastic!  Dannys Justa Pasta near South River, on Hwy 11 is good too.  Man, I travel so much that I have tons of good spots, unfortunately my memory for restaurant names is terrible.  Oh, if your ever on St. Josephs Island, go to The Lighthouse!

Mkiio's in Hearst Ontario. Best burger I've ever had in my life by far.  #2 on my top burger spot is Gilligans in southwest Ontario (its a chain).  Apache burger is right near my place but I've never been.... maybe I'll take the girlfriend this weekend.
You like burgers?

There's a really good restaurant in Meaford that makes a killer home made burger too. I can't remember the name though. Little place on the left side of the road when heading through town on your way towards Owen Sound. It's right in the heart of town seveal blocks West of the river.

Oh yeah! Apache burgers. That and C&W on Dundas in Mississauga was my after hockey treat growing up. Love chinese in Temagami Star burger in Campbellford House of Wings in Oakville for after avday salmon fishing

There is one Pub that I try to go to whenever I stopover in Sudbury called Grumblers.   Not the nicest looking place, but they serve the BEST suicide hot wings ever!!   If you like the hottest chicken wings, try these if you're in the area.  HOTTT WINGS!!  You have to order the hottest they have!   I also like the hottest wings from Moose Delaney's in Huntsville. So, we often eat there when we stay over in Huntsville chasing Splake in the Spring and Fall.   One place that I finally tried a while back was Weber's on Highway 11.  It really wasn't very good and I don't know what all the hype is about.  You want a good burger?  Try Golden Star on Yonge Street in Thornhill (just north of Steeles).  You have to order the homemade burger (the other one isn't very good).  AWESOME burger!   Beats Apache hands down IMO (Although, I like the Apache bun).
Henry's..  If you're riding with Wayne.  Decent pickerel dinner.

The Water Tower Inn in the Soo is not a bad place to end a fishing trip.  There is a good restuarant and bar. Indoor and outdoor hot tubs (all year long) good rooms, pool.  Great McGuffin photography all over the place. Not a bad spot to get cleaned up and relax. Kinnawabi Pines - good food but be prepared to wait and wait. There's a German place on Pancake bay that is great and another in Bruce Mines.  The Voyager near the Batchawana is ok for burgs. Nothing like the Wildcat or Bullocks in Yellowknife, although the Wilno Tavern on a Tuesday night is alright. Seems like the small diners with character are disappearing.
LOL Nick... I go to Frying Pan Island every Sept 24th if I can, but I've never been to Henrys! My best friend died on the back side of the island and I visit once a year if weather allows.

You talking about the Polish restaurant in Wilno near Bary's Bay ??  If so, they've got some of the best food anywhere and my wife & I make a point of driving up there every couple months for lunch.  Nothing fancy, but nice folks and great food !!

For all who may travel through Sturgeon Falls , our Chip Stands are really "World Reknown" for quality food... They open on March break and close Thanksgiving weekend.    I also like the Pine Rock on Hwy 11 N Marten River....  Randy
Twin Towers Restaurant Hwy 17 at Thunder Lake.
Another vote for Danny's, an excellent place.
The Moose in dowtown North Bay has awesome wings  Lots of sauces For a great greasy breakfast try the Texas Burger in Fenelon Falls  We hit it every walleye opener at Balsam Lake

Ok, I can't find that restaurant name in Gravenhurst, but it's located at the old "gravenhurst bar & Grill", right beside the Howard Johnson on Muskoka Rd. Definitly worth a stop, and it's not ridiculously expensive.
If you're on yonge st south of the 401 there is a place called Pastisima. Corner of Yonge and Sheldrake. Best chicken parmesan and ceaser salad. They make all the sauces from scratch
If you remember the name of the place in Gravenhurst let me know  And thanks!
Going back through my posts on Restaurantica to see if there's others. Just north of Minden (actually closer to Carnarvon) on Hiway 35 is The Pepper Mill Steak House, I enjoyed it.

"The Rock Pine" Randy.    The Blue Roof in Sundridge (no longer on the 4 lane highway) is great for a quick stop. If you are going further North The Bay Truck Stop is excellent.  In North Bay my vote goes to Burger World. Either of their 2 locations. ALL DAY BREAKFAST!
Rock Pine it is !
